website_summaries.verdict: Many offices and workplaces must provide a first aid kit for insurance purposes. The First Aid Only 100-FAE-0103 clearly meets those standards and contains a wide variety of first aid supplies as well as protective gear.
pros: Includes hundreds of emergency medical items for common workplace/office injuries
Can be customized or expanded for specific needs
Cabinet is well-organized and easily restocked
cons: Designed primarily for commercial applications, not a home first aid kit
Initial items limited in quantity, users urged to purchase proprietary refills, not generic alternatives

customer_reviews.title: Very nice and well stocked first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and well stocked first aid kit. I was looking for a first aid kit that I could mount to the wall in my landscape trailer. I have a crew of guys that use this trailer as their mobile office. We get bumps and scratches here and there and wanted something that was higher quality than your usual store bought kits. I also installed an eye was station below it. The guys and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: mbray94

customer_reviews.title: Very good kit for home/small office. Reordering site/app require business name.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kit versus the ones I've been getting at the local bulk retailer. The quality of the items are better than most kits. The refill system and kanban cards are very smart. The reordering site and app require a business name even though these are marketed a lot towards home HSA/FSA customers. The mounting kit and actual mounting of the kit is solid, while still being able to remove it from the wall in case you have to grab it and go. The doors and hinges are sturdy, the latch is strong but designed to breakaway and reassemble in case you tear it open during an incident.
customer_reviews.author: Russ L.

customer_reviews.title: Great initial product, replacement materials are overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Great kit for my place of business (restaurant) only issue is replacements are overpriced, so I end up filling it with alternate brands and things like bottles of Advil vs a box of little packets of two ibuprohen. The construction is good, the latch will break away if you’re in an “emergency situation” a cool cut his hand and rushed into the office, blew the latch off and was into the bandages right away. You can mount it or keep it like a carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Magee Fahey

customer_reviews.title: Great overall first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Great overall kit. I like the modular nature of the replacement boxes. I wish it had a more complete trauma set for the price, but overall it is still a solid value for a workplace first aid kit. I've installed two of them in my church and they've come in handy several times already.
customer_reviews.author: The Pinnacle

customer_reviews.title: i have a home office and after an incident
customer_reviews.text: with very bad finger deep cuts, i realized that i needed to have a nice first aid kit around. this kit is now fastened on the wall of my bathroom. that latch on the right side door works very well and was well thought out. it will be pretty durable as far as plastic latches go. you do have a little room in the left door to add some small things, so i added a box of wound seal and a splinter removal kit. i had my doubts about a plastic wall mounted kit, but it really is professional looking after installed on the bathroom wall.
customer_reviews.author: detailer

customer_reviews.title: Perfevt assortment for an office setting
customer_reviews.text: Great product for our office. I bought two. It has a great assortment needed for the office and the refill process for the items couldn't be easier. A card comes up when stock is low. The removable card has all the reorder information needed on it and the refills are the same exact product that came with the original. I added some extra over the counter medicine needed for a 24 office like mine and had room to fit it in the box. Easy to hang as well. My only complaint would be the lever to open the box. It easily pulls off if you aren't careful, but it snaps right back in.
customer_reviews.author: kporche

customer_reviews.title: Best assortment
customer_reviews.text: I have a culinary school and even though I don’t use these a lot ;) it’s nice to have this cabinet at ready and filled with anything I could need. Looks professional too.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Beacco

customer_reviews.title: The latch sucks but the kit rocks.
customer_reviews.text: The latch sucks. Mine broke 15 seconds out of the shipping box. I fixed it with a Velcro strap. Other than that it works great. Has little reminder cards when something might be running out. Nice kit needs a spot for us to add something for ourselves, I have need for larger bandaids but no room for them so I made a spot.
customer_reviews.author: Keith M. Banker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but plastic lever to open cabinet will break after several years
customer_reviews.text: As an office manager, I love how this cabinet is organized and how easy it is to reorder the items inside. They have recently updated the supplies to match the most recent OSHA standards (ex. CPR mask). We have 30 manufacturing/office employees and used this First Aid cabinet hung on the wall along with a separate portable Burn Kit and a Bloodborne Pathogen Kit. After 2 years of use, the handle/lever that opens the cabinet broke off. The opening lever is plastic and will not be able to stand years of regular use/abuse. But I couldn't find another First Aid cabinet that was as well-organized as this one -- especially for the price -- so I ordered it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: For some reason it will no longer ship to me.
customer_reviews.text: I dont understand what changed. I purchased this before with no problems. Now it says it requires special handling and will not ship to me. VERY disappointed. Its getting close to it no longer being worth paying for prime.
customer_reviews.author: Ak Miller Crew

customer_reviews.title: Best value out there!
customer_reviews.text: I own a small business and some of these can be super expensive. When i found this for $65 i can’t believe how good of a price it was! I bought a second one for home because it was so nice and really worth it!
customer_reviews.author: jb

customer_reviews.title: Someone forgot something...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back in 2017. This morning I had the first occasion to need it. This is what I found. An empty box where there should have been adhesive tape. Boy did I feel like an idiot. I’m gonna guess someone forgot to actually put the tape in the box during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: The Masked Chicken

customer_reviews.title: Great way to waste some Flex Account money
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice first aid kid. It has everything in smaller boxes that can be replaced by parts later on. It's clean and simple. Doesn't look messy inside. There are plenty of cheaper boxes out there, and they are probably giving more value, but like I said, I needed to use some flex money.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Best first aid kit for price!
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps the best first aid kit for the price. I live in the boonies, many miles from a hospital. A GOOD first aid kit is mandatory! With a few additions, just having this around is a comfort. I added triple biotic, iodine surgical wash, anti itch (cortezone, for bug bites), a box of gauze rolls and some larger bandages (abdominal pads, etc.). Has a much sturdier case than typical large car type first aid kits. I'm happy with purchase!
customer_reviews.author: D. Pedersen

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Quality
customer_reviews.text: Well the case is made of cheap quality plastic. The clasp to open the case broke off. It's cheesey and cheap. Will be returning for a better quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: Great for a workshop.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a friend for his woodworking shop that he just built on his property. It mounted great. Looks great. And has all of the items you'll need if most shop-related accidents happen. Bandaids. Aspirin. Gauze. Etc. - I recommend it. Only issue is that latch - it tends to come off when you open it. All you have to do is snap it back on when you close it. But still a bit of an annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stenger

customer_reviews.title: Great for household
customer_reviews.text: Never be caught off guard again. Great first aid kit for home. The reorder option means you never run out of supply. It my seem like over kill until you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Douquack2

customer_reviews.title: Inside is fine -- lots of supplies & room for more
customer_reviews.text: Inside is fine -- lots of supplies & room for more. Plastic carry case is poorly made. The latch seems to stick, but in fact will open with little effort. Label with opening instructions is on the INSIDE of the case rather than outside. Can't mount it in our work trailer as we feel it would open and spill contents if jostled off the wall. Would not purchase this model again.
customer_reviews.author: Diane N

customer_reviews.title: Large Smart Compliance Workplace First Aid Cabinet
customer_reviews.text: Nice unit. Everything one should need to handle most emergencies. Re-order number tags behind all products will help when it's that time. We got it for our Church.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Eyre

customer_reviews.title: Case is garbage forget the latch
customer_reviews.text: Good kit but would be better if they put more than 10 bandaids in each box
customer_reviews.author: Tim Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Good set
customer_reviews.text: Well it’s really nice set comes with lots of items but how ever. My set is missing tweezers not to hop in that for the price they should of doubled checked before shipping it
customer_reviews.author: Family Miranda

customer_reviews.title: Well organized and excellent quantity of supplies
customer_reviews.text: This is a great wall mount first aid kit. Everything fits in it very well and it has a great diversity of supplies. Perfect for the office, breakroom, shop, or club.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel NB

customer_reviews.title: Best wall kit I’ve found. GREAT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my company’s new shop, trying to keep everything very efficient. I was blown away with this kit. Far better than kits I’ve paid far more for. Buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jason C.

customer_reviews.title: WARNING!!! "Snap" latches on case are sharp
customer_reviews.text: WARNING!!!! "Snap" latches on the case , are sharp, I cut my finger opening it, ergo; the first thing I used from the first aid kit was a bandaid for my cut finger!!!
customer_reviews.author: None-ya

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Could use a few more trama supplies but for everyday use it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Low supplies, decent selection
customer_reviews.text: We ran out of the more commonly used items a little too quickly. This would probably be heaps better if it included a double the amount of band-aids, acetaminophen, and a few other more commonly used day-to-day items. If you want the presence of a First Aid Kit in your office this will do nicely.
customer_reviews.author: itsBorked

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good?
customer_reviews.text: Good kit, not sure why I’m seeing an expiration date on it a year and a half from purchase though.
customer_reviews.author: Ndannen

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: One quibble though, it has nothing for digestive troubles. If you need bandages, this is our product: every kind of bandage you could ever wish for is in here.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Sciacca

customer_reviews.title: Clunky and sort of fragile. Breaks quite a bit ...
customer_reviews.text: Clunky and sort of fragile. Breaks quite a bit in field use. It is still my regular pack around kit for high school cross country. Not much room for anything outside of the kit. Plastic is flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: TDW

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic first aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic first aid kit with everything you can think of neatly organized into little compartments. Easily wall mounted and simple to use.

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Much bigger than I expected, but that's ok. Everything looks like it's there.

customer_reviews.title: Great Office First Aid Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic office first aid kit, with the only thing missing is Tums.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for a workplace First Aid kit. It includes everything you might need.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Great first aid kit. I hang it up in the kitchen next to a fire extinguisher. Mobility is great as I can pop up the handle and take it on camping trips or family events.

customer_reviews.title: but it's great to have around
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my home, since I was tired of never having the random first aid odds and ends when I needed them. Probably overkill, but it's great to have around.

customer_reviews.title: A good and complete first aid kit for most work places
customer_reviews.text: A good and complete first aid kit for most work places, my only complaint is that the "FIRST AID" writing on the case, when wall mounted, is sideways.

customer_reviews.title: easy to mount
customer_reviews.text: So excited to get this for the office I am planning on ordering one for my home! Clearly labeled,well stocked, easy to mount, extra space for adding items like thermal blanket, thermometer, and CPR mask!

customer_reviews.text: My wife and I travel on the road and this first aid kit is the ultimate. It is put together well and easy to navigate. It supplies everything one would need in case of an emergency. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Great First Aid Cabinet for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Haven't found a better first aid cabinet for the price. Perfect for our small business. It's very well organized and well labeled, so each item is easy to find; it's also easy to see which items need to be restocked. You can restock most of the items--such as the bandages--with ones from any local drugstore, which is convenient.
customer_reviews.author: Hildog

product_meta.title: First Aid Only 50 Person Large Plastic SmartCompliance First Aid Cabinet with Medications , OSHA (1000-FAE-0103)
product_meta.description: Size:245 Pieces| Style:OSHAThe 50 person, large plastic SmartCompliance cabinet with over the counter medications is perfect for an industrial setting or a large corporate office. The unique cabinet design eliminates disorganized and missing supplies, while the clearly labeled compartments create a cabinet that is easy to use and restock. The expansion pocket allows you to customize your cabinet to meet your specific needs. The SmartCompliance cabinet SmartTab ezRefill System is a simple but effective way for reordering and restocking, revolutionizing the replenishment process. It is quick, easy, and cost effective. As supplies are used, Smart Tab ezRefill reminder tabs notify you when it is time to reorder supplies and puts reorder information at your fingertips. The FAO SafetyHub, a mobile requisition app, also allows you to monitor cabinet usage to stay compliant and know when to reorder your refills. The plastic case comes with a carrying handle and can be mounted on a wall or other flat vertical surface.
feature_bullets: PIECE/PERSON COUNT: 245 pieces sufficient to treat up to 50 people
SmartTab SYSTEM: SmartTab ezRefill System is a quick, easy, cost effective process for reordering and restocking
CABINET FEATURE: Wall mountable, plastic cabinet
IDEAL USE: Ideal for industrial facilties or large coporate office
